purpleculture_pinyin:
zhù
(literary) chopsticks
(литературные) палочки для еды
rtega_mnemonic:
箸箸RSchopsticks
  • person 者 using bamboo 竹 chopsticks to eat
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 者 indicates the sound; ⺮ (bamboo) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
玉杯象箸 [ yù bēi xiàng zhù ]: jade cups and ivory chopsticks; luxurious dining utensils (idiom)
玉箸流襟 [ yù zhù liú jīn ]: tears running down one's lapels (idiom)
食不停箸 [ shí bù tíng zhù ]: unwilling to put down one's chopsticks (idiom)
借箸 [ jiè zhù ]: lit. to borrow chopsticks; to make plans for sb else
无下箸处 [ wú xià zhù chù ]: too particular about one's food (of the rich) (idiom)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • ⺮ [ zhú ] bamboo; flute
    • 者 [ zhě ] that which; they who; those who
heisig_constituent: chopsticks, bamboo, someone, puppet, sooty, old man, sun, day
koohiiStory1: Bamboo, lovedoll: At dinner, my lovedoll decided to eat her meal the Japanese way using chopsticks. But well, what a problems she had getting those bamboo shoots into her mouth (which should not be that difficult, I would say!).
koohiiStory2: I´ve always wanted to use bamboo chopsticks to eat sushi off a naked woman. Unfortunately, there is no woman in my life, so this love doll will have to do.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You give bamboo to someone and they make them into chopsticks. They are very talented at turning bamboo into bamboo chopsticks. This someone is an expert at their profession.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Watch this person take ordinary bamboo and transform it into chopsticks right before your eyes. Hear the whooshing and whittling sounds as they form the bamboo into chopsticks with expert speed and precision.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Now use those chopsticks to eat some delicious hash (はし) browns! That's what chopsticks were made for. That's what they're always made for.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine trying to pick up hash browns with your chopsticks. They would be really hard to eat if you didn't have these handy eating tools!
Ru_trainchinese: zhù: (сущ) (книжн.) палочки для еды
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the person (者) uses bamboo (⺮) chopsticks

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 箸 from bamboo-top 𥫗竹 zhú and phonetic ink-mouth 者 zhě C772 箸<筯> simp 箸. (name- bamboo-top-manifest 箸 zhù)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
Originally 箸 meaning manifest now meaning chopsticks. Then 著 now meaning manifest. Then 着 meaning to take action. see 躇 鐯𨮿

箸字的基本解释

箸
zhù
筷子。
一种生在南海岸边沙中的竹子。
古同“著”，明显。

箸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhù］
［《廣韻》遟倨切，去御，澄。］
亦作“櫡1”。
筷子。
[②]［zhù］
［《廣韻》陟慮切，去御，知。］
同“著1”。
(1)显明。
(2)撰述；写作。
[③]［zhuó］
［《集韻》陟略切，入藥，知。］
同“著4”。
(1)附着。
(2)穿着。

箸字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　箸； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页891第03
〔古文〕?【廣韻】遲倨切【集韻】【韻會】遲據切【正韻】治據切，?音宁。匙箸，飯具。【禮·曲禮】飯黍毋以箸。【史記註】箸卽筯也。　又與櫡同。【史記·絳侯世家】景帝召條侯食，獨置大胾，無切肉，又不置櫡。【註】櫡，《漢書》作箸，食所用也。【嶺表錄】南海岸邊沙中生沙箸，一名越王竹，相傳越王棄餘算而生，若細荻，高尺餘，春吐苗，箕心茗骨，靑而且勁。南海人愛其色，以爲酒籌。凡欲採者，須輕步向前拔之，聞行聲，遽縮入沙中不可得。　又【集韻】陟略切【正韻】直略切，?音著。被服也。一曰附也，黏也。【戰國策】智伯曰：兵箸晉陽三年矣。【註】箸，言附其城。　又【廣韻】【集韻】?同著。【列子·仲尼篇】形物其箸。【註】形物，猶事理也。事理自明，非我之功也。　又與宁同，門屛閒也。【周語】大夫日恪位箸以儆其官。

箸字的源字形

箸字的起名意思

暂无。

chopsticks
Source glyph
chopsticks
Name meaning
Nothing.
(缺)
著 zhu
(附]著zhu 着zhuo
“著”、“著”、“着”三个字,同出一
源。古籍常可通用,现在则往往有
别。“著”以“竹”表义,以“者”(古音
近“诸”)表音,本义是“筷子”。“著”
的一些义项后写做“著”;“著”又分化
出“着”字。
(同楷书)
甲骨文
金文
隶
书
皆
に 书
简化字
画 薔篱 蓄 著羔三
(недостаток)
Чжу
(Прикреплено) Чжу, Чжо
Три слова «着», «着» и «着» имеют одинаковое происхождение.
Древние книги часто бывают универсальными, но теперь они часто другие.
«Чжэ» использует «бамбук», чтобы выразить свое значение, и «чжэ» (древний звук, похожий на «чжу»), чтобы выразить свое произношение, и его первоначальное значение - «палочки для еды».
Некоторые значения «着» записываются как «着» после некоторых значений; «着» делится на слово «着».
писец
все
に Книга

zhù
книжн. палочки для еды
一份匙箸 один столовый прибор (ложка и палочки)
下箸 приступить к еде
象箸 палочки из слоновой кости
Radicals: 竹, 者  (bamboo, someone)
Meaning Mnemonic
You give bamboo to someone and they make them into chopsticks. They are very talented at turning bamboo into bamboo chopsticks. This someone is an expert at their profession.
Watch this person take ordinary bamboo and transform it into chopsticks right before your eyes. Hear the whooshing and whittling sounds as they form the bamboo into chopsticks with expert speed and precision.
Reading Mnemonic
Now use those chopsticks to eat some delicious hash (はし) browns! That's what chopsticks were made for. That's what they're always made for.
Imagine trying to pick up hash browns with your chopsticks. They would be really hard to eat if you didn't have these handy eating tools!
